p: SLEV is a mosquito-borne flavivirus transmitted to humans by Culex spp. mosquitoes, first discovered in 1933 when a large epidemic of encephalitis occurred in St. Louis, Missouri [ 150]. SLEV distribution ranges from Canada to Argentina and across North America [ 266]. SLEV produces a mild febrile disease in children and young adults and severe neurologic manifestations that are more frequently observed in elderly and immunocompromised patients.
